results.title: Raiders of the lost ark
results.creator_credit: Steven Spielberg, Frank Marshall, Lucasfilm, Ltd. and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Harrison Ford immortalised the character of thrillseeker archaeologist Indiana Jones in this first of the series. From the opening sequence filled with huge crawling tarantulas, golden idols and giant rolling stones, “Raiders of the lost ark” is a rollercoaster of thrills and action. Jones is on a mission to find the missing Lost Ark of the Covenant and encounters evil Nazi’s, slithering snakes, mummified bodies and red tape before he achieves his mission. Co-starring Karen Allen and Denholm Elliott. A great movie from master blockbuster filmmakers George Lucas and Steven Spielberg.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Steven Spielberg, Frank Marshall, Lucasfilm, Ltd. and Paramount Pictures

results.title: Barefoot in the park
results.creator_credit: Gene Saks, Hal B. Wallis and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Jane Fonda and Robert Redford star in this Neil Simon comedy about a newly married couple. Corey and Paul Bratter begin their marriage in a tiny one-roomed apartment up six flight of stairs with the weirdest neighbours on Tenth Street. Corey is vivacious, fun-loving and impetuous, while Paul is a rising and very serious young Attorney. Joy turns to anguish, but they kiss and make up in the end. Fonda and Redford are delightful, while Charles Boyer as the aging Romeo who lives in the attic, and Mildred Natwick as Corey’s meek and mild mother are excellent. The script has the wit of Simon’s New York perspective.

results.title: All the mornings of the world = Tous les matins du monde
results.creator_credit: Alain Corneau, Jean-Louis Livi, Paravision International, FR3 Films, SEDIF, DD Productions, Divali Films and Film Par Film
results.brief_description: An award winning production recounting the life story of master 17th Century musician M de Saint Colombe (Jean-Paul Marielle) and his brilliant protege, Marin Marais. Marais (Gerard Depardieu), reflects on his life as a student when he fell in love with his mentor’s eldest daughter Madeleine (Anne Brochet). Guillaume Depardieu portrays the young Marais. The musical score, costumes and settings are outstanding.

results.title: Like water for chocolate = Como agua para chocolate
results.creator_credit: Alfonso Arau and Arau Films International
results.brief_description: Multi-award winning Mexican film which tells the story of Tita who is forbidden by tradition and a tyrannical mother to marry Pedro. Tita finds solace for her suppressed passion and sorrow in her cooking, which has a profound effect on all who partake. Based on Laura Esquivel’s best-seller, “Like water for chocolate” is an enchanting film which radiates warmth and emotional depth. It is visual feast starring Marco Leonardi, Lumi Cavazos and Regina Torne. Spanish dialogue. English subtitles.

results.title: One hundred and one dalmatians = 101 dalmations
results.creator_credit: Clyde Geronimi, Hamilton Luske, Wolfgang Reitherman, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Pongo and Perdita settle into their owner’s home and become the proud parents of fifteen beautiful dalmation puppies. Cruella De Vil thinks that the litter would make a perfect dogskin coat and with the help of her henchmen, steals the puppies. Pongo and Perdita and their canine friends, embark on a dangerous rescue mission, and at last are reunited with their children and more dalmations! Based on the novel by Dodie Smith. Features the voices of Rod Taylor, Betty Lou Gerson, Cate Bauer, Lisa Daniels, Ben Wright and others.

results.title: Dial M for murder (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Alfred Hitchcock agreed to direct this masterful adaption of the broadway play by Frederick Knott merely to fulfil studio contractual obligations but “Dial M for murder” became one of his most acclaimed thrillers. Anxious to inherit his wife’s fortune, society playboy Tony Wendice (Ray Milland) ingeniously plots her murder. Blackmailing a former associate with a criminal record, he arranges what appears to be a perfect crime. However, his scheme is foiled when Margot (Grace Kelly) stabs her attacker with scissors. Wendice must now take his sinister web of intrigue in a different direction to cover his tracks. Co-starring John Williams.

results.title: The Magnificent seven (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: John Sturges, Alpha Company and Mirisch Corporation
results.brief_description: In a stroke of filmmaking inspiration, director John Sturges saw the possibility of transposing Akira Kurosawa’s film classic “The Seven Samurai”, from feudal Japan to the American West and it worked brilliantly. Yul Brynner stars as the leader of a group of skilled gunfighters hired to protect a poor Mexican village from marauding bandits led by the vicious Calvera, played with ruthless delight by Eli Wallach. Fighting alongside Brynner and Steve McQueen are Charles Bronson, James Coburn and Robert Vaughn, whose film careers were launched by this film. With a now-classic musical score and stunning cinematography, “the Magnificent Seven” provides exciting entertainment as well as touching on the themes of dignity, honour, courage and survival. The film established a new standard for future generations of Westerns.

results.title: Red river(Captioned)
results.brief_description: Director Howard Hawks’ classic western stars the legendary John Wayne at the peak of his career and Montgomery Clift in his screen debut. Walter Brennan heads the outstanding supporting cast. The film is an account of the first cattle drive over the Chisolm Trail, from deep Texas to Abilene, Kansas. Authentic detail and stunning cinematography bring to life the trials and tribulations of this extraordinary challenge for the men who battled the dust, rain, heat and frustration of the long, hard drive. The demands of this rigorous journey further strain the edgy relationship between the film’s key characters. Tom Dunson (John Wayne) is a self-made cattle king whose single-mindedness has turned him into a cold-blooded executioner, ruthlessly determined to take the cattle to Abilene his way. Arguably the best western ever produced, “Red River” captures both the grandeur of the early West and the sheer determination of its people.

results.title: Calamity Jane (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: David Butler, William Jacobs and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: The Wild West in a spectacular musical with Doris Day as Calamity Jane and Howard Keel as Wild Bill Hickcock. Calamity Jane arrives from the “Windy city” after finding a star attraction for the local saloon. As she is taken by the “Deadwood Stage” to the “Black hills of Dakota”, she meets Wild Bill Hickock, her “Secret love”.

results.title: The Great escape (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: John Sturges, Mirisch Corporation and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: A classic Hollywood war film, combining a gift for storytelling with bravura and blockbuster entertainment. Set in a high security German P.O.W. camp, the Allied prisoners are determined to do more than wait out the war and plan a daring escapes. Steve McQueen slams his motorbike into top gear and hurtles us into an adventure accompanied by stars the calibre of James Garner, Richard Attenborough, Charles Bronson and James Coburn. Based on the novel by Paul Brickhill.
